Reviews.Title: Nice little camera with high zoom, great HD video
Reviews.Author: Jin Won Sung
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a week ago, and I am pretty pleased with the picture, video testing so far. I also have ZS3, which takes great outdoor shots but poor indoor shots with flash. So I was curious how much indoor flash shot is improved with ZR3. I was happy to see that indoor portrait shots from ZR3 came out much better with more accurate skin colors and the annoying reddish cast from ZS3 seems to be gone with ZR3. Flash is a little improved. Still catching far subject indoor with zoom is challenging as the flash shoots ISO up too high and makes pictures too reddish, grainy. So, like ZS3 I had to adjust exposure settings in normal model (flash off, IS mode 2, auto ISO, min shutter speed 1/8, etc) and rely on my hand-holding skill. But considering that this is small camera, it is understandable.In outdoors, the ZR3 takes just takes beautiful crisp pictures with iAuto mode and I am very happy with the results. Overall I highly recommend this camera to people looking for simple, automatic one with high zoom, HD video.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful  high definition Video  with optical zoom in still camera
Reviews.Author: kevin Bruce "Kevin in Atlanta"
Reviews.Content: I bought this versatile camera for a trip to Cuba. Great stills. VIDEO is amazing, because full optical zoom can be used while shooting. Video is true high definition and  plays on HD Television and windows seven computer.  Video taken of dancers in a cabaret and of reflections on water at night were great.  The LCD is amazingly sharp. LCD is bright too.  Battery life is good. Camera is light and fits in my pocket.  Did I mention that I love the ability to optically zoom while taking great high definition video, which is still very rare?  All my older video cameras are history.  I love it. Oh, it turns on fast, and power switch is a tiny excellent toggle.  Clever power saving too.  Still photos are great, with good low light ability.  So rush and buy it

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Wanda "Wanda"
Reviews.Content: I am an extremely poor amateur photographer, and this camera makes me look great!  We took both still and video of my friend's BD party just after we got it (without reading the manual) and both turned out great.  The video quality is amazing.We took 2 videos, one with a relatively high end Sony Video camera (HD) and one with the Lumix (HD).  The quality of the video was the same.  The Sony had better controls on the zooming, but amazingly, the sound quality on the Lumix was better.  Of course, you can hook up an external mic with the Sony, but still....I can't say enough good things about this camera.  I was looking for something small that would fit in my purse, and this fits the bill and has tremendous quality as well.  There are some manual controls for experienced photographers, but I am a strictly point and shoot girl.  The auto focus feature determines the correct setting, and the majority of the pictures I have taken are great without fiddling with anything other than the zoom.

Reviews.Title: PANASONIC WON ME OVER WITH THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. HU "QT"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Panasonic camera and may I say it is THE BEST CAMERA I HAVE EVER OWNED. My last camera was a Canon which also makes a great camera, but this Panasonic camera blew my Canon away. The image quality is outstanding all around, even in low light situations. I took this camera to rock concert last month and it did an amazing job even in the low light conditions of the concert arena. Also you don't have to worry if your hand shakes, because it still takes a sharp crystal clear picture. Also it is great at catching fast action moments that are sometimes hard to catch. As for the video, it is amazing, great quality and sound. Also you can zoom in and out with this camera while recording, which to me was an important option to have in a digital camera. I am very impressed and I can highly recommend this camera to anyone who is still not sure which brand to buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!!! No regrets!
Reviews.Author: J. Edgar
Reviews.Content: I previously ordered the Panasonic Lumix DMC FP1R which is a great camera, but you can't zoom in while taking a video.... hence I sent the camera back.This model is exactly what I was looking for in a camera (I had a Konica Minolta for years and was looking for an upgrade since a couple of months already), the zoom is great, you can zoom in an out while taking a video and the volume is adjustable which is great, the pictures are very clear and the colors are authentic, the display is crystal clear, the camera is light and small and has a really long battery life.I have it on iA (intelligent auto) all the time and am very satisfied with the quality of the pictures... for the ones out there who like to play around with the settings.... there are plenty of them, you can even choose between 4 zoom options. Personally I like it simple, therefore iA for me all the time. :)Oh and I even took a picture of a sunset (against the light of course) and it came out beautifully, I was really impressed.5 stars from me, there is really nothing I miss or have to criticise

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Thomas Kulig
Reviews.Content: The Lumix DMC-ZR3 is a very good camera. I especially like the AI setting which is great for a quick point and shoot pictures of the grand kids. The pictures are easily downloaded to my computer using the supplied USB cable. Overall I'm very pleased with the Lumix ZR3, it takes a great picture and is easy to operate. This a must for my wife, there is no setup or lens adjustments for light or distance. This is my second Lumix camera.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: WPM
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an everyday complement to my Canon DSLR, which is excellent, but too big to carry around most of the time. I wanted a high quality, high zoom camera that would fit in my pocket. The size of the Panasonic is great- it's one of the smallest cameras with a 7x or larger zoom. I liked the Canon SX210, but with its widescreen LCD, I thought it was a little too big. 8X is at the low end of the zoom range I was looking for, but it works pretty well. With a 14MP image, I can always crop a little in software to zoom in tighter and still maintain good quality.The quality of the ZR3 is excellent. Outdoor shots in sunlight are excellent. Indoors shots are very good. Like most compact cameras, you don't have as much control as you'd like. There are about 20 scene modes, but no easy way to simply set the aperture to its widest setting to get a fast shutter speed. One feature I like is that you can put a max limit on the ISO speed so the camera won't jack it way up in its search for a fast shutter speed. That usually inserts considerable noise in the picture. I set the max ISO at 400 and noise is excellent. I haven't shot much above that, so can't comment on noisiness at higher ISOs. However, almost all compacts start to degrade above 400.Video quality is very good. You can zoom while filming, as some newer cameras can now do, which is a great feature. It has the space-saving ACVHD format, although I use the motion JPEG because it's hard to find software to edit the ACVHD.The wide zoom of 25mm comes in very handy when trying to get all of an indoor scene or a big group of people.I like this so much and the portability is so good, that I find I use this camera for most of my needs. I'll use my SLR for shooting my kids sporting events or if it's low light and I need the high ISO capability of the SLR. But it's so nice to have a high quality option that fits in my pocket. I'd highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, nice features and nice price
Reviews.Author: rozman
Reviews.Content: I previously owned an earlier generation Panasonic Lumix compact camera and was very happy with it.  I did a lot of research prior to purchasing the DMC ZR3 and have learned that over the past few years Panasonic has made quite a name for itself in the camera industry.  The primary reason for me upgrading was that newer cameras have HD recording capabilities as does the DMC ZR3 and also I was attracted to the large optical zoom capability (8X) with such a compact camera.  It is only slightly larger (hardly noticeable) than my previous Lumix, which I bought largely for its compact size.Pictures are nice quality.  Like any camera you buy -- especially compact -- pictures with a lot of natural light are going to turn out the best.  If you plan to take a lot of pictures of scenery or the outdoors during your traveling I would recommend this camera.  It takes very nice quality photos outdoors.  Indoor photos are not quite as sharp generally, but sometimes they can turn out pretty good if you are able to have a decent light source.  honestly, sometimes I force the flash off if there is enough artificial light to make due.The HD video pretty much follows suit with the still photo quality.  Best in good natural light situations, tending to be grainy in low light.  And because it is video as opposed to still frame, the granularity is more pronounced as is to be expected with probably any camera until you get into professional grade (and big bucks).  I find the ability to connect to an HD TV using a mini-HDMI cable very handy.  You should be able to find a generic mini-HDMI cable online for less than $10.  You should realize that when using the HDACV Lite mode of recording, it works nice for TV playback, but is not as PC friendly as it requires the included Panasonic software to load that format onto your PC.  You do have the option of recording in the less memory-efficient motion-JPEG format which will allow you to load directly to a PC without software, making videos more conducive for sharing.I have found the strong zoom to be good quality in terms of maintaining sharpness of the subject.  When you have the zoom at maximum or a very high level, you have to keep it very steady -- especially in lower light.  I have not yet attempted using it with a tripod, but I am confident that would produce quality results.Bottom line is that I paid less for this camera than I did my first Panasonic Lumix (which I really liked) and it has a lot of nice recent technological improvements which I find very useful.  It's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: T. McGrath
Reviews.Content: Great product. Works well and is durable. Quality of the video is superb and software to view and edit the mts and/or mov files it produces is available online for free. Using a class 6, 32GB SD memory card and it works flawlessly. My only complaint is that in lower light settings the pictures are not as good as the video; they seem too dark. But that is when using the camera on full auto mode; I'm sure a real photo buff can alter some of the settings and make low lighting shots as good as the video. Other than that a great camera for the money that I highly recommend. Long battery life too.

Reviews.Title: Good Zoom & Wide-Angle Lens, but Unfocused Low-Light, Flimsy Lens Cover: "Stay Away"
Reviews.Author: Snark Twain
Reviews.Content: This is the first negative review I can remember writing for an electronic item. I usually research reasonably well and end up happy with my choices, but not this time. Reviews talked about lens, zoom and functionality, and while there's some truth there, the overall package makes this not worth your time.On the good side: The cameras size is decent, it's light, and the optical zoom really gets you in close to a seemingly impossible degree. I was impressed by that. The wide angle lens also works up close in a way that's better than anything I've experienced.On the bad side, sadly: The light weight felt a little flimsy, as did the battery cover door.  The lens cover was unusually thin too, and while this seemed odd, I trusted it, but I was wrong.  After a week, the lens cover is broken already.  The camera's been in nothing more stressful than my jacket pocket and briefcase pouch, so there's no reason for it to be broken, unless it was poorly designed.  On another count, photo-taking, the camera falls short too, very short, in three ways:  1) POOR IMAGE-STABILIZATION: While the zoom gets you in close, the image stabilization is lousy in zoom.  Why have a zoom capability if your image stabilization chip can't shoot a clear photo at that zoom-level?  It makes the zoom useless.  2) POOR LOW-LIGHT SHOTS: The low-light photos are fuzzy and color-deprived. When this camera says 1600 ISO, it's nothing close to what I'm used to from my previous cameras at the same ISO.  3) POOR FOCUS: The focus just isn't as sharp as I'm used to from Canon, and shots come out fuzzy even in decent light.  Really not what I'd expect from a product released by a company with Panasonic's reputation for making quality products.Panasonic has made some products I really enjoyed, especially the pre-LED TV that I had for a decade. But it's hard to imagine buying a Panasonic camera again, and I highly recommend against it.Sorry, I wanted to like this, I really did, but now I'm going through the trouble of mailing it back defective, and starting my research again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: E. Johnson
Reviews.Content: After many hours of online research I chose the ZR3 as my new digital camera.  I compared it to the other Panasonic cameras such as the ZS7,ZS5,ZS3,ZR1 and the FH20.  I was also considering the Canon PowerShot SX130IS.  The main reason I chose the ZR3 over the Canon was the difference in size.  I wanted something small and lightweight and the Canon did not fit that requirement.  The FH20 seems very similar to the ZR3, the only difference I seen was that it records movies in quicktime format instead of AVCHD lite and you are not able to use zoom while recording.  It does not have the intelligent zoom either.  I felt those added features on the ZR3 were worth the $40 difference.  But I didn't want to spend another $90 to upgrade to the ZS7.  I am very happy with my choice so far.  I have only had the camera 2 days so far.  It takes good pictures and video and that's what I wanted.  I was looking for a new camera with 8X zoom or more.  My old camera only had 3X zoom and that was not enough.  The pictures in low light are not excellent but they are acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Has hidden defects! Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: A. Gronowski
Reviews.Content: When I was researching cameras, the Dmc-zr3 seemed like the perfect one for me. It has a high zoom and many features, and is small enough to carry in my pocket. So at first, I was very happy with this camera. But after about 10 months of use, I started seeing black spots in my photos. At first, I thought that this would go away if I cleaned the lens. However, after doing some research, I realized that dust has gotten into the lens and onto the sensor. This dust appears as black spots on all photos, and can't be easily removed. I used the camera for only a year, and I took good care of it. I have never seen this happen before, and it is a serious defect in the Dmc-zr3. However, Panasonic refuses to admit that they are at fault. My warranty has now expired, and Panasonic told me that the repair has to be done at my cost. To remove the dust, the camera has to be taken apart, and this can cost $150! Furthermore, it seems that Panasonic is aware that their camera has this defect, because it appears that they have quietly discontinued the zr3. I have checked many websites, and Amazon is the only one that still sells this camera. Don't buy it unless you plan on using it only a few months and then throwing it away.

Reviews.Title: COMPACT SLR
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: When I first got this camera I was first skeptical about buying a Panasonic since all my past point and shoots were Canons, but after taking it to Cape Code for the weekend I have grown to LOVE this camera.The reasons being:-IT IS TINY !, Panasonic packed a buttload of MPs into this compact little camera.-Resolution! The onscreen resolution was great, but when I got home to upload pictures I was able to zoom in to acutally see grains of sand on beach photos.-Compact SLR, My friend and I were taking pictures of landmarks while in a car, and I was able to get super clear picture while moving at 40mph. When my friend and I posted pictures taken by both cameras he was unable to tell which came from the SLR and which came from the Pani. (NOTE: THE SLR DOES TAKE A LOT FASTER PHOTOS BETWEEN SHOTS)-HD VIDEO, This is just great. Ability to capture sound could be better.-Design, I'm a guy and I don't like carrying things that's looks or feels dainty. My other friends have compact high MP point and shoots but it all looks wayyyyyyy too dainty for my taste.Well hope this helps, happy moment capturing !

Reviews.Title: READ: It lasted for 1 year - Panasonic will not repair! - Exchange: $ 128
Reviews.Author: sur-y-despues
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera exactly 1 year ago, and it worked fine. I used to have a Sony Cybershot for many years, and I wanted to make a change. It was not as good as the Sony but the pictures were very good. Suddenly, two spots appeared on the camera, and they never went away. I did some research and I found out that is a problem with the CDC or Image Sensor.I called Panasonic Support but they said that they won't repair it. They will exchange the camera for a refurbished one, and of course, I will have to pay for the exchange.Very disappointed! I was punished by Sony.UPDATE 06/21/2011: Panasonic Support referred me to a different unit of their company: The Panasonic Exchange Center. The name says it all: They will NOT repair the camera: They offered me an exchange for a refurbished one for $ 128.35 plus the cost of shipping my camera to them to McAllen, Texas. I am appalled to say the least. The person on the phone was very nice, and she told me that lots and lots of people call every day, and get extremely upset when they found out Panasonic's pseudo-repair policies. She said that Panasonic reads the Amazon reviews, and that if people start being more open and proactive about their experience with them; they might consider change their policies.Doing research online, it seems that the Lumix series has a "common" problem with the CDC or Image Sensor, which is the reason why the WARRANTY only covers the CDC for 6 months (parts) and ONLY 90 days (labor). DON'T BE FOOLED: The one year warranty does not cover the whole camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera
Reviews.Author: keno
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Sony W230 that I was unhappy with.  This camera is the same size as the Sony, but has so much more!The 8x zoom is great, especially nice that you can use it in movie mode.The video recording is quite good, in all different modes.  I took some really good 4th of July fireworks movies in standard VGA and also in HD.  The HDMI output works great with a $3 cable from Amazon.I use this camera as a companion to a Canon DSLR, not as my full time camera.  However, it works so well that lately I've been using it, just because I like it.  The response times are very fast, including startup and focusing.The image quality is great so far.  The only noisy photos I had were in a very dark room with the flash turned off, or in a dark room where the flash was not strong enough to light the far away subjects.The camera is easy to operate, easy to use, and it fits in your pocket!  Overall I love this camera and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great amera.
Reviews.Author: Joseph T. Dietz "joedietz"
Reviews.Content: So far we love this camera.  We have owned it for about 2 weeks but we have taken over 200 pictures on it.  It takes good action shots and good low light shots.  The pictures are clear and sharp.  The camera is easy to use and I like how all the buttons work.  The zoom works very well and I love the 10x zoom.  The stabilization works well with the zoom all the way out as well.  Videos seem to work well too.  I was a little apprehensive to buy a Panasonic because I have always had Kodak and assumed Canon and Nikon were better, but I am glad I chose the Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Dust / black dot, not useable after 1 year.
Reviews.Author: Fula
Reviews.Content: It's hard to believe that the dust can go into a point and shot camera.  But it happened to my Panasonic DMC-ZR3 after one year warranty is over. A black dot appears in the center of the screen and picture. It is not useable anymore.I bought this camera one year ago from Amazon as my backup camera and my old camcorder replacement. I was a little bit disappointed for the photo quality after received it. I think my 10 years old 5MP Olympus C50 took better pictures than this one. But this is a good replacement to my camcorder, because it is very small, wide angle zoom lens, HD(720p).  I am quite happy with it. I use it for family video and use a DSLR for photo. If this camera still works, I will give it 3 stars for photo and 4.5 stars for video (considering the price and size). I give it 1 star because this type of camera should not have dust problem.There is no point to spend money to repair a $200 camera. I just upgraded my Nikon D40x to D5100 to add the video function.Update (5/2013):There several videos in youtube showing how to clean the optical sensor for the similar camera. Thanks for the people who put the video there. I tried few days ago. It was quite easy and took me about 15 minutes. The dust was fairly large (kind of fiber material)in my case. It was on the optical sensor.The youtube video shows the detail procedure. The only additional step for this camera is that I have to remove both back & front covers in order to remove the large metal plate behind the optical sensor block.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but very poor low light performance
Reviews.Author: c
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix ZR3 camera is a good camera. I tested earlier a Canon SD-1400 and the Panasonic was a good improvement. Pictures will come in focus almost always in contrary to the Canon that has huge problems with the auto focus specially indoors. The camera size and ergonomics are just good. The camera is compact but not ultra-compact. It will still fit in a jeans pocket, but a little bit tighter. The Canon sd-1400 felt much smaller and no doubt has a much sexier design.The zoom and the HD video are very strong points for this camera. The HD video was very good and you can use the 8X zoom while shooting with no noticeable motor noise.My main problem with this camera was the indoor picture quality, specially in low light conditions. We wanted a simple point and shot and neither myself nor wife like to get to play too much with settings. Most of my tests were using the Intelligent auto mode. Unfortunately a lot of the pictures indoors at night will come with a yellowish color. The flash seems not to be powerful enough for the job. I know that it is a problem of many compact cameras but the picture quality was just unacceptable.After some more research I finally bought the Sony Cybershot DSC-WX5. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003VCEDR0/ref=oss_productJust to be clear, although I got the Sony on sale, the price price point is a little bit more expensive than the Canon and Panasonic cameras that I tested. My rational was that I want to keep the camera for some years, so the extra $80 will not be a huge deal taking in account that I'm getting a superior product.The Sony really delivered so far the promises. Picture quality is outstanding indoors and outdoors. In low light the flash is powerful enough and you still have the option to shoot without flash and get very good natural pictures. The video quality is amazing. It shoots 1080i in stereo.

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Strand "strand2k"
Reviews.Content: I have gone through every high end point and shoot camera.  I first had an Olympia. Then, a Sony, Kodak, and then Canon.  Every year my wife got a new camera.  But, there was always a image quality that just missed my mark.  I tried lumix.  It was an older model. Wow.  Image was perfect.  I know perfect is a subjective word.  But, it left all the other cameras behind.  Movies were great.  Simple to use (all cameras are pretty easy).  But, the results were great. No comparism.  I didn't know how they would improve.  I guess they did with a new engine.  Movies were better and more versatile.  Group shots were fantastic with face recognition.  Even with the wide angle lens, all the shots excelled.  They did this right.  I would recommend everyone to get one.  I wasted a lot of money (cameras back then ran about $3-450.  Save yourself from trial and error.  Get the camera that makes photos "pop".  And, image stabilization is the very best the industry has.

Reviews.Title: Best fit
Reviews.Author: Researcher "carver1469"
Reviews.Content: We just had our first child and the camera we had was slow and many of the pictures were blurry. All of my friends wanted me to get a SLR camera but I wanted something small I could carry around in my pocket for those special moments that just pop up. I spent time reading reviews on a lot of sites, especially Cnet.com and Amazon.com. This camera was the best fit for my needs and had all the features I wanted and none of the fancy stuff I didn't. It takes great pictures, we are totally satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: No as good I had hoped
Reviews.Author: Flamingo
Reviews.Content: I am a pro photographer who bought this camera because of the wide angle Leica lens which most point and shoots do not have.  There is a long lag time between exposures which means you cannot capture anything in quickly. You have to wait several seconds between exposures. It also does not take good photos in low light situations-photos come out blurry even when you make an effort to stay still.  Sharpness is also an issue-lens does not live up to the Leica name. My Canon Elf performs much better than this camera. Disappointed in the Panasonic's overall performance and I would not recommend buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: DUST catcher - STAY AWAY!!
Reviews.Author: Ivy
Reviews.Content: Nice little carry-around camera.  But the lens is trapping dust on the inside, so it cannot be cleaned out with out taking it apart or sending it in for service.  This happened in a few months of well-treated use.Panasonic should be doing something about this, but as far as I can tell, they aren't.STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: NOT RELIABLE !!
Reviews.Author: fabdk59
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year, after 10 days and without any reasons, some black dots appeared on all new pictures.I returned it to Amazon that sent me a new one. Same model & same problem after 4 months !!Now Amazon tells me I have to send it to some place in Texas to get it fixed by Panasonic. The thing is that I moved to Europe and so, sending it there is too expensive...I'm very disappointed because the camera never crashed on the floor. I really took care of it.Some other problems:#sound troubles while shooting a movie#poor quality of night pictures with objects at distance (pics are fuzzy and yellow)I won't buy a Panasonic Lumix any more.

Reviews.Title: a nice little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Echota
Reviews.Content: This is my first pocket/snapshot camera - I've always had SLRs or digital SLRs before.I bought it because I was finding myself wanting a camera to take along anywhere, in any situation. Though I heart my digital SLR (A Nikon D70s), it is not always practical to take it along places, and so I am often finding myself somewhere thinking how I wish I had a camera with me, but knowing the impracticality of bringing along my DSLR.I also wanted a camera that would be easy for my 5-year-old to use, because he is also very interested in taking photos wherever we are. Point and shoot is perfect for that.I did a ton of research before I bought this one - I always do. I wanted to make sure I bought something that had great photo quality for the price range and that would be capable of taking photos in many different environments.I'm pleased with this purchase - for the price, this is a great little camera - and I LOVE the HD video feature. I hadn't even considered this when I bought the camera, but I am so glad it comes with it - I love being able to take little video clips when we're out and about.I'm finding it to be very intuitive and easy to use - the manual had the advanced feature description I was looking for. I don't use the software, I just use Picasa, so I cannot speak to that, but it is really really easy to use - everything is. I'm still playing with it and experimenting with it, since I just got it for Christmas, but I'm very glad for this purchase - it does just what I want it to do.Oh, and the photo quality is pretty darn good - its no DSLR, of course. but I'm happy with the results for the price.

Reviews.Title: A fabulous, often bypassed,  top of the line point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: OldPhotoGuy
Reviews.Content: I'm about to give a great review to a camera I returned. As someone about to become a new grandpa, I finally have a new photo opportunity coming my way so it was time to re-evaluate my arsenal of cameras. For years I loved (and still do) my Canon Rebel film SLR with the standard 18-55mm lens. Set on automatic 90% of time it captured all my children and pet's antics on Koday Royal 100 Film (remember that?) till all were gone. But film just doesn't make sense or meet our immediate need for gratification in today's digital world. So when that era faded, I stuck with Canon and after much evaluation, bought a Canon Powershot Elph SD450 (5mp) which has been my main camera for several years now. In the two years that followed, I bought two of my grown kids the Canon Elph SD500 and Canon Elph SD750. All basically the same camera with a few more features and more megapixels. We are all more than pleased with the very small size, durable metal construction, excellent photo results including videos, and ease of transferring to our PC's. So when I got the Panasonic ZR3, I compared it in a shot-by-shot contest against my older Canon SD450 and the new, highly advertisied Nikon S8100. Needless to say, I used many difficult shooting situations, including low light and macro situations. How did they compare?  I'll cut to the chase and give you my bottom line results and opinion: the Panasonic ZR3 was my favorite amongst the three, as I felt it did the best job OVERALL with both snapshots and video, plus it had that sturdy all-metal feel in a very compact body, very similar to my Canon SD450. And there lies the rub: the results were so close to my Canon SD450, I could not justify spending another $180 without getting SIGNIFICANTLY better results in a different camera. The other factor that turned me off on the Panasonic was this: it was much more difficult learning to dump the pics to the PC with the included software than with the Canon using the USB cord method, but that can be mastered with practice or maybe even eliminated with a SD card reader (I just ordered one). And if you have an older PC like I do, you'll probably need to download one of the free high definition players off CNET like KM Player to view the HD movies. But that is true, no matter which HD movie mode camera you purchase if you have an older computer to work with. By the way, for those considering the Nikon S8100 which can cost about $80 more than the Panasonic ZR3, it definitely has many more bells and whistles, but if you're shooting on automatic most of the time, here's some of why I passed on it: It's not as compact as the Panasonic ZR3 and it has a plastic feel to it. I could not get use to the auto pop-up flash that kept popping up in the exact spot where my finger was, delaying many shots. It did do a fabulous job taking fast snapshots in low light with that CMOS sensor over the CCD sensor, however, the deciding factor had to do with it's videos. The Nikon's videos in low light were bright but it did not want to focus when I was zooming in, which resulted in much unacceptable out of focus footage, whereas both the Canon SD450 and Panasonic ZR3 snapped into focus.  By the way, I feel I should mention that the ZR3 is a great value and the forgotten step-child in the Panasonic Z line as you don't find many reveiws on it; most go right for the next step up, the Panasonic ZS5 because it has more features. But if you're going to shoot mostly in automatic modes, you don't need those and can save about $50 in sticking with the ZR3.So did I ever find a new camera worth buying with my limited budget? Yes, I did! As a retired person, I really didn't have the budget to buy the digital version of my faithful old Canon Rebel SLR which was about $500, so I settled on the next best thing within my budget: a high-end point and shoot compact zoom that looks and feels like a DSLR without the cost or weight and has a great 18X optical zoom, as well as all the automatic point and shoot modes any new grandpa could want! I purchased the highly rated Panasonic Lumix FZ35 from Amazon and alhough I've had it less than a week, I already love it and it's a great value at about $250. It has techinically been replaced by the FZ40, but many reviewers like the older FZ35 model better and you will save another 40 bucks.  So far, I agree!

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed a great point and shoot that does a lot more.!!!
Reviews.Author: Angelo
Reviews.Content: I already had the Panasonic Lumix GF-1 and it gave me a lot of possibilities but I needed a smaller camera to carry around with me for those unexpected opportunities to just point and shoot.  It fits in a case right on my belt, and when I need to use I just pull it out and its 14.1 mega pixels give me clear and fantastic pictures which I can later edit to my requirements.  Small, light, flexible and technologically advanced, it is the right camera for anyone who wants on the spot shooting without the hassles of carry larger format camera, accessories, bag, etc.  I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing performance..
Reviews.Author: Nessa Kumaran
Reviews.Content: I was very excited for this camera. The specs sound great on it and I liked the video recording features it had as well as the long zoom. Unfortunately the picture quality was terrible when used for anything other than bright sunlight. At ISO 400 there is already very noticeable noise and it just gets much worse from there. I gave two stars because the video quality still manages to be pretty nice. Still, this is a camera first and due to the noise it was just not good enough and I returned it. Also, FYI non-Intel macs will not be able to play the video format for this camera and the camera software is PC only.I ended up settling on the Canon Powershot 210SX IS. It has the same basic features (and much more manual control) plus more zoom and MUCH less noise. In other words, it actually works as a camera.

Reviews.Title: Look Elsewhere
Reviews.Author: czfw89
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera based on various "professional" reviews, but overall performance is poor.  I may have gotten a bad example and probably should have returned it, but I didn't.  So here's what I have found in about 9 months of use.One of the factors in purchasing this camera is the 8x optical zoom in a very compact size.  This camera easily fits in a shirt pocket or pants pocket.  The small size does not compensate for poor performance.The 10x intelligent auto zoom is unusable.  The idea is that this is supposed to be a really good digital zoom that gives near optical zoom quality and a bit more magnification.  Instead, it makes soft, poorly-focused images even in bright sunlight.  I generally don't use this setting for fear that I will zoom past 8x and ruin the photo.Which brings us to performance in moderate to low light conditions.  One word: terrible.  If you need the flash and get more that a few feet from the subject, noise (random-colored pixels generated by the sensor, not your subject, that make the picture look grainy) dominates the images.  No exaggeration here, I think maybe 25% or more of the pixels are in error in typical room light.In regular auto mode, images are ok in daylight, but never really sharp.  My son has a five year old, 8MP Canon A590 and the images from that camera are far superior--sharper, better contrast and color, much less noisy.This camera's one positive performance is video.  It uses AVCHD (also known as MPEG-4) to store HD video and consume much less memory or hard drive space versus MPEG-2 or motion JPEG.  Interestingly enough, the video images generally look better than than the stills.  This is the only reason I kept the camera - good HD video in a small package.  The video got this camera an extra star, otherwise, it is a one star product.I wish the camera manufacturers would stop bowing to marketing pressure and stick with the high quality 10-12MP sensors.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera
Reviews.Author: Blue82
Reviews.Content: This is a great all around camera.  My old Canon Powershot was getting a little slow to respond and had no video capability.  The low light results were poor at best, but I understand the limitations of the sensors on the smaller cameras.  I bought a Nikon P100 last fall.  It takes great low light shots and gives me a lot of flexibility to play with shutter speeds and aperature settings.  Those things come with the price of a much larger camera body.After reading a lot of reviews on Amazon I settled on the Panasonic.  It takes great quick shots in all kinds of situations and does a pretty decent job in low light.  I like the intelligent auto setting.  I usually get the shot without a problem.  The added feature of video made it perfect for me.  I work with international exchange students through my Rotary district.  This camera is great for getting action shots on trips and at conferences.  Due to its small size and weight I can have it with me all the time.Make sure to use a good quality SD card.  Don't skimp and try and save money in this area.  It will have a detrimental effect on the camera's performance.  Spend the extra money and get the class 10 card in at least 8 gig.  Don't miss that next great shot because you are waiting for the camera to write your last photo to a cheap card.

Reviews.Title: Sorry I bought it
Reviews.Author: V. Martin
Reviews.Content: At first, I was really happy with this camera. Takes good pictures, easy to use, large display, lots of nice features, perfect size to carry around. After 11 months, I noticed dirt inside the lens that shows up on screen and on every picture I take. Yuck. Luckily, it was still under warranty so I sent it back to Panasonic and got a replacement (same model but refurbished). But the replacement was totally defective. When taking pictures in daylight, the screen and photos turned bright pink. Sent the replacement back to Panasonic and got refurbished replacement #2. After a month, I noticed dirt specs inside the lens again. What is it with this camera and dirt? I had another compact camera for 3 years and never had this problem. So I'm calling Panasonic for a THIRD time to see what my options are. I'm hoping I can exchange this lemon for a different model because I'm sick of this camera and wish I'd never gotten it.

Reviews.Title: Legit point and shoot
Reviews.Author: mcoons
Reviews.Content: Pretty strong little camera for the cost. I've compared this particular camera with rivals from Nikkon, Cannon, etc, and was more than impressed with the final product. Camera takes fantastic pictures in low-light and fast motion settings, which is more than can be said for some of its competitors. Picture quality is incredible. Display and functions are easy to use. Might just be the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. B. Groot
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my wife's first digital camera. It was a hit (which wasn't easy). It is quality, easy to use and shoots great pictures and video. I'll probably get one for me too!

Reviews.Title: panasonic dmc-zr3
Reviews.Author: S Falls Teske
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price, the pictures are beautiful and the settings for the camera are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - lousy software
Reviews.Author: TomInIll
Reviews.Content: This may seem like a picky point to some.  After all, the camera is great.  It takes great pics day, night with and without flash.  I have used the video recording feature at Karate to record katas and it was flawless. But back at home I still have to use HP software to view and modify the pics!Believe it or not, the software is not Windows 7 64bit compatible, even though it clearly touts its Windows 7 compatible logo on the ads and the box!  After using an HP R707 camera and HP software for the past 5 years you get used to your camera and your software working hand in hand.  Now I'm having to cobble together software to handle the different aspects of what should be seamless.  Very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumic DMC-ZR3
Reviews.Author: Yusri B. Muhamad
Reviews.Content: The best compact camera I've ever owned.Took perfect pictures and never had a bad one.Really recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Skipper
Reviews.Content: This camera has been to several countries with me over the last 2 years and most pictures taken have been just what I had expected when I pressed the button. When I bought it, it was as good as was available at that time. In fact it was so good that I could easily skip a couple of generations of this camera. But now the ZS20 is out and everything is further improved: Zoom, speed, low light performance, and new features I didn't even dream about when the ZR3 came out. Testet a few other cameras but came back to Panasonic once again.

Reviews.Title: Easy to get lint on screen!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few months, and it is fine as far as picture/video quality. When I bought the camera, I did not go out and buy a carrying case, which I should have. It seems to open a lot on my own (in my pocket and my purse) as the switch on the top of the camera is easy to hit. Therefore, it opens and closes unnecessarily  and picks up lint. So I have had it four months, and now have dots on the screen. I"m hoping to return it. That is an inconvenient problem. SO buyer beware! I read this happens a lot with these little cameras, they pick up lint! And then your pictures really do look amateur.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Ltram
Reviews.Content: We bought this Lumix because a previous model had been lost/stolen.  I was sad to lose my previous Lumix, but feel the incident ended up being a blessing in desguise because I LOVE this newer model!  There are more pixels for added sharpness in the photos, increased user-friendliness in the multiple of settings (including a movie button all by itself), and the ability to zoom in and out during movie recording.  GREAT PRODUCT!

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: kzmcgrl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go with me to London and Paris and it was fantastic.  My pictures of the Tower of London and the Eiffel Tower are crisp and beautiful and the zoom is incredible.  I got architectural details of Big Ben and the Eiffel Tower that are great, and a clear zoom-in on the Arc de Triomphe from the top of the Eiffel Tower at night was astounding.A big reason I chose this camera is that my old one was so difficult to change settings on, I had to go into a menu to go through other menus to get the appropriate setting to try to get the shot.  By then, I had always missed it.  This camera was a great pick for getting into menus.  The dial on the top of the camera is super easy to get to and it only takes a little practice to get to know the many settings available.  I found the night settings and a few others the ones I used the most so locating them was very quick.Also, turning the flash off was very quick so if I took a photo in ambient light that wouldn't work with the flash, I could make a quick change and turn off the flash and get a great picture.  And when the flash was off I still (usually) got a nice, still photo (the long-distance Arc de Triomphe at night on zoom took three shots to get it perfect but it worked.)Speaking of zoom, it is SO easy to get to the zoom and it was super-fast responsive and focused so quickly, I could zoom in and get the shot, even if it was something or someone moving, very quickly and easily.I tried the video a couple of times to capture street performers and they were nice and crisp, the sound was good but obviously not great as the mic is built-in and some of the performances were at a bit of a distance.The battery is generally good.  I got almost two days of near constant use out of it but didn't keep an eye on the battery level so I ran out toward the end of day two, grateful that I had gotten most everything I wanted to.  It also charges fairly quickly, less than two hours, I'd say.All in all, I'm completely thrilled with this camera.  It travels well, is relatively light, fires up quickly and takes really beautiful photos.  I'm a complete novice and this camera really makes my shots look great.  I'll try to add some photos...

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Jill G. Rosenberg "fresberg"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take photos of my grandson and to take photos of mountain scenery.  I am happier with my purchase than I even imagined I would be.  The parts that are important to me: 1) I can set it to not use flash so it doesn't bother my grandson, 2) I can set it on automatic, and it handles everything, 3) I can take great videos that include adorable little baby sounds as well as capturing his activities, 4) It takes good telephoto and wide angle photos of mountains, wildflowers, etc.  I'm really, really happy I got this camera.

Reviews.Title: A+
Reviews.Author: Stephanie P. "Stephanie P."
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. It is quick, sharp, and the color's are really exceptional, with, or without flash. Obviously, without the flash you have to have a steady hand/subject because the picture is more likely to be blurry, but this is true with any camera. With the flash, however, you can literally move the camera across the room while taking a photo and it will still focus on one thing and take a great photo of that.The video quality is awesome! Also great that it has a zoom. Even in low lighting it takes a perfect video and actually seems to make the room appear lighter than it really is. My camcorder didn't even take as good of video's in evening house lighting. The sound is nice also. I also love that with a push of a button you are recording video. No fumbling through any menu's, or changing a dial. Just the push of the button and you're recording!There are a ton of special settings on this camera to choose from. I also liked that you can have it set up in a few different modes so that you can just switch the top dial to change to a commonly used setting so you don't have to fumble through the menu each time you want to use that. You can just turn the dial and you have it ready to go. It's also nice for the more experienced user because you can manually adjust the settings (shutter speed, etc.). For me, I prefer to use the Intelligent Auto setting most of the time. It seems to work well. There's only been a couple of times where it's been stubborn because it didn't want to take a photo until it was completely focused. But that's only happened once or twice.Over all, I'm the third person that's owned a Lumix, although we all have different model #'s. And everyone I know loves it. One is an experienced photographer and she says this is almost as good as her high quality professional camera. Another person is a completely inexperienced camera user and her pictures are really great. You'd' never know she was a beginner. And she says it's easy for her to use.I'd definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great until the inevitable black spots
Reviews.Author: J. Carnegie
Reviews.Content: I had my first DMC-ZR3 replaced by Panasonic within the warranty period because black spots started showing up in all of my photos. It was explained to me by a guy in a photo shop that the issue was dust on the sensor. Unfortunately, based on other reviews, this experience sounds all too common. Too bad, because it's a great point-and-shooter until it craps out.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera! Been discontinued for a reason
Reviews.Author: Praxus
Reviews.Content: My friend and I each bought one of these cameras in summer 2010. Just over 12 months later (conveniently after the warranty expired) I noticed that my camera had dust spots on the sensor or inside the lens assembly, rendering the camera useless. Now get this - the same thing happened to my friend about a week later! After doing some googling, I found numerous complaints about dust getting inside the camera that cannot be removed. Panasonic should be offering free replacements; but they are not. Instead, they quietly discontinued it. Amazon seems to be the only retailer still selling it. Do yourself a favour and look elswhere. The new Canon 310 HS, or the SX230 look pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Wise choice
Reviews.Author: A. Hussein "AbdouRetro"
Reviews.Content: Camera is great for all types of photography, The Leica optics are just as good as the Carl Zeiss optics on Sony cameras. Video is very high quality and allows zooming during filming which is a good feature that's missing from many compact cameras available today. I would suggest every new owner to read the operating manual in case they are not happy with the intelligent mode, because the manual mode options are all new and need some explanation.for $200 its an awesome deal!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Mopar Seven "Prov 29:18"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera that works well in fully automatic mode or using manual settings. Very fast response time makes it easy to get the pictures I want to get. Easy to use and even fun to use. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: GeeTee
Reviews.Content: After some research and consultation and having been in the photo industry all my life, I decided on the Panasonic DMC ZR3 as my choice for a new digital camera.  Based on what I learned before my purchase, I've not been disappointed in the least.  This is a wonderful camera, very user-friendly and it takes incredible pictures and videos.  I've already recommended it to friends who have also shown an interest in getting a new camera.  I can also recommend 17th Street Camera as the seller.  I've known that in the past, some New York mail-order houses had a reputation for not fulfilling their promises, selling "Gray-Market-Goods", etc.  But 17th came through with flying colors.

Reviews.Title: best compact zoom camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "yankeewhaler"
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th digital camera. I started 10 years ago with a 1.7mp fuji and thought i was king of the hill..Then came the big zooms and heavy slrs...now im back to an easy to carry camera, and love it.. I only miss the polarizing adapter..ill figure one out  The camera is a little joy.. READ the instruction book on the cd...limit the iso to a max of 800..use the ai setting..let the camera shoot as it was programed to and you'll get excellent pictures..  The little flash will not light up a large room.try 10 feet..same as sony or nikon..its too small..so if i know that I'm going to a reception a carry a slave flash in the other pocket and get 20 feet of flash coverage.  enjoy the camera

Reviews.Title: Great, easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph A. Braddock "joepat"
Reviews.Content: I wanted an easy to use point and shoot camera with good picture quality and video.  This camera does the job and then some.  It is the best digital camera I have ever owned.  The picture quality is great and the HD video is even better.  With a mini HDMI to normal HDMI cable you can plug this camera right into most HD sets with ease.  I have a 60 inch Sharp and everything looks flawless from the camera.  I haven't even tapped into all of the features and I am very, very satisifed.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants to shoot quick, quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: this camera has exceeded my expectations. I was back and forth on several different cameras, but landed on this one in the end. very pleased at picture quality. it also takes very good pictures of moving targets. the night time setting is more than acceptable, although not perfect. battery life is descent as well.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but terrible indoor pictures
Reviews.Author: Syed Z.
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to take with me to indoor events and for family pictures at home. I eventually decided to get this based on some reviews I read but later found out the flash is very weak. When I received it, the initial pictures looked ok, however, when I started taking flash shots indoors or with incandescent lighting present, the pictures came out extremely dim. When I turned flash off, the picture looked better but iso was increased leaving me with a noisy and unusable picture. In fact, I deleted most of the flash pictures and choose to keep the noisy iso 800 pictures instead.I tried to play around with the settings on the camera (exposure, flash options, shutter speed, stabilizer system, etc) and tried it under different lighting conditions but nothing worked. Considering the nice build quality and small size, I tried making excuses not to return the camera. But after I compared some pictures with other cameras on the imaging resource website, I determined the flash on this camera was below average. I returned it just in time and Amazon was great with the return process and gave free return shipping.The only plus side to purchasing this camera is if you plan on taking ONLY outdoor shots, it may be a good bet. And the video quality is great. But a camera should be versatile otherwise its useless in certain conditions and considering the zr3's indoor shots, I would advise against purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera that we've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: A. Bergman "HD Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: Every picture is bury.  Using the auto or manual settings have no effect.  Almost every picture is also over exposed.  Received the camera a week after purchase.  After a week of frustration and testing, we discovered that we can not return this terrible camera due to a 14 day return policy.  Our old 5mp Olympus out performs this 14mp camera in every way.  May take a sledgehammer to it do to the frustration of wasted money.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I hoped!
Reviews.Author: R. Siqueira "RWS"
Reviews.Content: I have compared this camera with another Panasonic that I own (Panasonic DMC-FH1), which I got from Amazon last year for $89.00. After taken the same pictures with both the ZR3 and the FH1 using the iAuto on both as well, I was surprised to see that the pictures from the FH1 were better. The 25mm from the ZR3 and the 8x zoom is nice compared to the 28mm and 5x zoom of the FH1, but the indoor shoots from the ZR3 were inferior to the FH1. The FH1 indoor shoots were brighter and a little sharper. The ZR3 indoor shoots were darker, not as sharp and showed more noise. Perhaps, the small/weaker flash of the ZR3 with the 25mm lens is not a very good match. I bought the ZR3 for my wife to take pictures of my kids at school, birthday parties and daily events. However, since most of her shots would be indoors, the ZR3 didn't cut it for us. I decided to return the ZR3 after comparing it with my FH1, and my wife will have to wait for a better camera. Outdoors the ZR3 does a very good job with the 25mm, but so does most compact cameras under good lighting conditions. I did a lot of research before ordering the ZR3, read lots of professional reviews and user reviews. It had more good reviews than bad, but after testing it my score is average. I will probably have to save a little more and get a more expensive camera with a faster/brigther lens.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix MC-ZR3 camera
Reviews.Author: maple leaves
Reviews.Content: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00395YA86/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_titleThis is a great little camera.  I purchased it from Amazon Warehouse and the description read that the camera would have blemishes on the front and/or top. There are none.  The camera is in perfect condition.  Pictures are good.  I have a large Canon camera which has more tricks included but I am taking his camera hiking, canoeing, etc.,  and it's the perfect size.  I've read that people complain that the control buttons are small, but this is a small camera so you have to expect that.  The features on this camera are quite intuitive.  Overall, a nifty pocket size camera to haul along wherever you go.

Reviews.Title: First impressions: impressive video quality, poor low light photos
Reviews.Author: valy
Reviews.Content: I received this camera three days ago, and this is my first impressions:Pros:1- The video recording is awesome, even in low light2- Outdoor photos are very nice and the colors are great3- the optical zoom is good4- the design of the camera very goodCons:1- Very very poor image quality in low light, so if you want this camera for indoor shots i'd advise you to stay away, because i bought it for indoor usage and i'm disappointed now.2- Very limited options in intelligent mode (iA)3- Bad flash lightI'll update this review after few days.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: mikel
Reviews.Content: Good friend & amazing photographer,Dwytt Dayan,when i asked why he had two Lumix cameras & what should i get? He told me"Lumix got Leica lenses!need I say more?!!"Well he did say more! I took his advice & got the ZR3. I've been away from  photography since before the digital takeover. I'm pleased! Leica lens is still as sharp as the film shooting days!Sharp images,even at 16x enlargement.  Ease of operation is good,most functions can be learned without the manual.Size is quite portable,just a bit thicker than a cell phone,Nice screen size,2/3 the size of the camera.Good motion pictures,good sound!Good price.nice.

Reviews.Title: Great features, low-light issues
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera about a month, but I was surprised how poor the indoor pictures were while using the Intelligent Auto focus.  I've played with some of the camera settings and manually improved some things, but this is a step I didn't have to take with my last Canon.  That being said, its portability and video taking I love.  The video does not suffer from the same low-light issues as the still shots.  For the money, this camera offers a ton.  I just wish it peformed better indoors, where most of my pictures are taken this time of year.

Reviews.Title: Good IQ on well lit situations
Reviews.Author: intellectually_stupid "iisgenius"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the good reviews. It takes good pictures only on well lit situations. Forget indoor use. The IQ is just unacceptable. I had an older lumix before and that camera is five times better than this one especially in low light situations.. or hardly any light at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: lkg14830
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. This is my second Lumix and I am sold. The pictures are crisp, colorful and it's ease of use is commendable. The sport setting captured water drops at the seashore, the sunset setting captured amazing sunsets in Maine. It is small enough for your pocket but powerful enough for even the best of photographers that want ease of use. The zoom is more than adequate and image stabilization works fine.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZR3 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Andrea Fournier "quasar235"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC-ZR3 takes excellent photos both inside and outside.  The incredible zoom brings the action up close and viewable.  The controls are logical and easy to use.  The internal menus make sense and can be found quickly every time.  This camera is just the right size and easy to hang on to, even with one hand.  There is minimal shutter delay which plagues lots of other camera brands.  Panasonic did a nice job designing this small but powerful camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: N. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take pictures during a cruise vacation and I am so pleased with the quality of the pictures.  It is simple to use and the small size made it easy to take everywhere.

Reviews.Title: An amazing Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Henry C. Englund "Gus"
Reviews.Content: This is an anamazing camera given its size. It does what I wanted: I can put it in my pocket and get fairly decent photos. Screen glare is a problem outside in bright sun.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Redtag "sew amazing"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace an older Olympus point and shoot digital camera after doing extensive research and looking at several different brands of digital cameras.  I wanted more zoom power and this little camera delivers on that.  Also, the wide angle lens makes beautiful pictures of large areas.  It is very easy to use with easy to read buttons and settings.  I wanted a large view screen (3" or larger), but this 2.7" screen works fine, and my pictures that I have made so far have beautiful color and clarity with the AUTO setting.  I recommend this camera for any photography novice who doesn't want to fool with a lot of settings.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: KristenTag
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera a lot.  It is very compact so it is easy to bring with me and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera ever
Reviews.Author: M. Barbaro "M2Baro"
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. It was easy to use and carry and took great pictures. My 2yr old took it in his baby pool with him and when I tried to replace it I was sad to learn it no longer exists.

Reviews.Title: Stay away
Reviews.Author: maiziell
Reviews.Content: After painstaking research I suggested this camera as a gift for my daughter. She absolutely loved it, especially the macro pictures. But like other reviewers, after a little more than a year, she noticed black flecks on the  lens. I cannot understand why so many folks suddenly develop this problem at about the same time in their camera's life.This is the second time she has had a problem with a camera from a reputable company (the first was a Canon S2, not a cheapie), that the company does not fess up to a design flaw or defective part.I saw a review where someone found a YouTube video to clean the spots off, will update if it works, but bottom line, I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LUMIX Camera
Reviews.Author: Saeed Eslambolchi
Reviews.Content: Good camera, except for night photography and real close-ups. Pictures with flash aren't as bright as you want them. Good lens, lightweight. Overall very happy after three years of ownership.

Reviews.Title: camera rating
Reviews.Author: Patricia Steber
Reviews.Content: It is the perfect compact camera. It takes amazing pictures and we just love it. Terrific. You ask to much. shouldn't have to count words for comments.

Reviews.Title: Still being used and like it
Reviews.Author: bascar
Reviews.Content: Still using this camera as of 11/21/2013, and still working great.  However, it's been eclipsed by newer models (the XS20 that we've since bought) but if you want a good quality camera for a beginner or someone who doesn't need a whole bunch of bells and whistles, this one's for you.  I take it with me when riding my motorcycle, which I probably wouldn't want to do with the pricier new one - I don't mind if it gets scratched sliding past the zipper of my jacket pockets

Reviews.Title: Very good pictures but...
Reviews.Author: Scott DeMoss "peerless"
Reviews.Content: I love love loved this little camera and it served me well for almost three years.  Then it got dust on the sensor.  So I learned from YouTube how to take it apart and remove the dust.  I congratulated myself on being so handy.  Three months later, dust on the sensor again.  Fixed it again.  Three months later, dust on the sensor again.  Groan.  I replaced it with a different digital pocket camera from Panasonic.  I loved it a lot but it had a fatal flaw.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3 14.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: N. Cousino
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for most amateur photographers and everyday use.  We use ours mostly for family photos and snapshots on the go, and this camera is easy to pull out of my bag and quickly snap a few pictures.  The camera's zoom is fantastic and can make such a difference between an ok picture and a really great picture. I find the display and options are pretty easy to navigate and use, and it's also easy to download your pictures to your computer afterwards.I really like how light the camera is - it makes it easy to slip this into a pocket or small bag for trips.  While the camera is light it does seem very sturdy - we've had ours for quite a while and used many times and I've never had any issues with the shutter door or battery cover - they are holding up just fine.  The battery seems to have a pretty long life as well - with occasional use we charge this once every couple of weeks.Don't be afraid to play around with the options on the camera - if certain pictures aren't coming out the way you like, try changing the flash or speed, practice different shots until you find what works for you.  You don't have to be a professional photographer to have fun with this camera and take some great photos - I love it and will definitely buy from Panasonic again in the future.

Reviews.Title: broken after two years
Reviews.Author: New user
Reviews.Content: I have loved this camera since I purchased it two years ago. But seems like nothing is made to last. Something is broke in the lens or dust as others have mentioned. It will cost more than the camera's even worth to fix. I have read many bad customer service reviews for Panasonic so I have decide to try a new brand. If you purchase I would recommend an extended warranty.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, BUT...
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely stellar for a point-and-shoot.  It functions extremely well in many situations.  I've captured gorgeous pictures in low light (theatre shots), as well as outdoors shooting sports, scenery, and fast action.  It also takes great videos.  Plenty of pre-programmed settings mean anyone can easily find the right "scene" for what they need.  The zoom is fantastic and you can even use it while recording video.BUT...after one year, it's useless due to dust on the INSIDE of the lens.  There is no way to fix it without taking the camera apart or sending it to Panasonic, which just isn't worth it.  The shutter over the lens is fairly flimsy, leading me to believe that it just doesn't do the job of keeping the lens safe.  I keep the camera in a case when not in use and clean it regularly, but there's just no way to get rid of (or, apparently, prevent) the dust that made its way inside.

Reviews.Title: pleased with camera
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Abrams "Mike the professor"
Reviews.Content: So good I now own two. Very sharp pictures and easy to use. Video is nice but acvhd mode required separate program on Mac to convert. I have been using Borosoft conversion software. You don't have to use acvhd as there is another mode for video. It may be that Imovie 11 will read acvhd so check. Anyway, i have gotten also some fairly good macro shots but it takes some playing around to get that right as focusing is sometimes hit or miss. For family pictures inside or outside, this is a superior camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I ever had
Reviews.Author: davidbec
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely good. I've had it over 2 years now and its still great. I recently bought an underwater case for it and now I can record when I go diving.Can't find anything bad to say about this camera.Zooms while recordingexcellent video and still qualitygood stabilizationeasy to use functionssmalllightvery fast startup. I use a 16GB Class 6 card.Get it!!

Reviews.Title: Same black spot problem after 18 months
Reviews.Author: R. Ivan Ross
Reviews.Content: This has been mentioned in a few reviews now, so I would say this is a serious flaw in this camera.We noticed the black spots appearing after about 18 months, now 4-5 months later the camera is pretty much unusable and we are looking to buy a new one.  Not great after less than 2 years.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE WARRANTY & CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: Natyadevi
Reviews.Content: the camera itself is a solid digital camera.  it's made in japan (not china, like 99% of digital cameras), which was a key factor in my purchase.HOWEVER, panasonic's warranty and customer service are terrible.  so be warned: if you purchase this and something goes wrong, you will likely have to pay a ton of money and wait a long time.8 months after i bought the camera, there was a grey mark in the same place in every picture.  my lens was defective.  there was no trauma to the camera, but i do wonder how it was fine for so long, then suddenly this problem.anyway, i called panasonic and they told me i had a THREE YEAR WARRANTY.  so i left the camera at my parents home and thought, "i'll fix it next time i'm in town."  (i live abroad, so i need to be in the US to take care of such things.)  i came back 1.5 years after i bought the camera and found out it was a ONE YEAR warranty.now i'll take some blame in not reading the manual, which does say 1 year.  but still, i was misinformed by a panasonic representative.  today i called to see how much it would cost to fix the lens out of warranty - $130!!!  or half the price of the camera.  and it would take several weeks.most people need their camera for an upcoming event or trip and cannot wait this long.  panasonic should have a faster turn-around.having told me bad experience, i will say the camera itself took very good photos and was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: BLACK SPOTS KEEP APPEARING
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Szydlow
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading positive "hype" on internet and on camera sites. Camera did take great photos until permanent black spots appeared on all images ruining travel photos. Camera failed in less than a year while under warranty. Panasonic replaced original with a refurbished camera. The same problem occurred within a few months on the refurbished unit. CAMERA DESIGN IS FLAWED. For the price paid, I expect the camera to last longer under normal use. Panasonic customer service is not easy to deal with; live customer service reps only repeat that they "service cameras for free under warranty," multiple requests to speak with senior people go unanswered.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Clifford
Reviews.Content: I love it and it's really easy to use. I had determined that my next point and shoot would record in HD and working at indoor soccer arena the results have been stunning. Uploading the videos of game to Youtube has produced videos that look sharp and the camera does well to keep up when auto focusing resulting in less blur. Generous viewfinder. Only drawbacks would be the microphone is located at the top of the camera which leads me to covering it a lot and the resulting muffled audio is disappointing. Also the battery is proprietary so either buy an extra or be sure to have it charged before going out.

Reviews.Title: Easy "Learning Curve"
Reviews.Author: L. Mason
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace my Kodak EasyShare, which I was happy with except for "closeups".  Being 60+, the "learning curve" was intimidating, but once I set aside time to actually read how to use it, it turned out to be very easy.  I am very happy with this purchase.  It will be the last camera I ever buy...does everything I need it to do.  Maybe I'll tackle that iPhone thing next...

Reviews.Title: Very poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Scott Davis
Reviews.Content: Maybe we were unlucky and got a dud, but since the first day we used this camera the pictures were all washed out.  It wasn't until we had some pictures to compare to over the holidays that we realized just how terrible they were.  All of our pictures are very washed out and have very little detail.  I am not a novice camera user, but an avid photographer.  This was to be my small camera and I didn't expect much from it but I did at least expect reasonably clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera - a good choice
Reviews.Author: Trakie1
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3:  Love it because:  - It does a decent job at capturing the moment - especially in continuous shooting mode.  - Takes decent video, and you can capture a still shot fromt eh video, which I love. It is a little grainy, but not terrible.  - Portability. It is great to have a decent camera in your purse at all times.  Wish it could:  - Produce even better quality photos. Don't get me wrong - this things takes a great photo. But, don't we always want better?  - Zoom farther so I don't have to crop as much. Yeah - sometimes I miss the action b/c I am not close enough  - Stand up a little better to frequent use. My first ZR3 developed spots on the photos. It was a manufacturer's defect, and Panasonic was great about exchanging it. The replacement was loved as much as the first. But it, too, developed spots and was now out of warranty.In the years of owning the ZR3 our photography needs have changed, so we did not re-purchase the Panasonic. We wanted a super-zoom and spent considerably more on our new camera. However, if I still needed or wanted a small camera, I wouldn't look any further. I really loved this little camera, and I would buy it again in a heartbeat, even despite my concerns.

Reviews.Title: Not very durable
Reviews.Author: Ugly Dudley
Reviews.Content: The camera took decent pictures. However, it lasted just over a year before breaking down. The lens started to retract awkwardly when I turned it off. Eventually, it stopped retracting altogether. I used a fully charged battery, but it still could not bring it back to life.

Reviews.Title: fantastic digital camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: lakshmiluvsvishnu
Reviews.Content: I've had a Panasonic Lumix digital camera for 1-1/2 years now & I like it so much that when my-son-the-lawyer kinda shocked me by mentioning that he didn't currently have a digital camera, I sent this one to him in Hawaii (where he lives & works).  I mean if you live in HI you need a great camera, right?  So now he has one!  He LOVES the Lumix DMC-ZR3, he raves about it every time he calls home.  And he better start sending me pics of Hawaian sunsets, etc. really really soon!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Photo Quality
Reviews.Author: S and K Reviews
Reviews.Content: I did a great deal of research and finally settled on this camera for Christmas last year.  I just don't enjoy taking photos any more.  We have low light in our house, and the quality of pictures is poor.  The photos are often blurry.  I find the settings confusing and the instructions limited.  The videos will play on my camaera, but not my computer.  I have researched that, but am unable to find a solution.  Last week I purchased an IPhone 4s and am hoping to just get rid of my camera completely.  I would stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this camera.  Great picture and video quality, zoom is pretty nice, I love the little dial so I can quickly switch between video, intellegent auto, and pre-sets.  The view screen is nice and big.Drawback: shutter speed is still slow.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for chasing around a kid.
Reviews.Author: Slacking off
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take snapshots of my toddler and it's great!  Small enough to take anywhere, and takes great pics and videos.

Reviews.Title: Need advice with camera operations.
Reviews.Author: Digital Novice
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera as a gift. I like the quality of the pictures and movies, but I am not a digital genius. Does anyone know of a good book or dvd that will help me learn to use all the features? The manual that came with my camera is not helpful to me.

Reviews.Title: nice buy
Reviews.Author: dinky5
Reviews.Content: Overall, my wife and kids are all pleased with this purchase!  Easy to operate, adequate speed, and enough photo options for most occasions....we'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: mss
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, nice features, easy to use interface. Panoramic view function has some minor issues. Camera has only 2 interface languages (english and spanish).

Reviews.Title: I like it better than the newer models
Reviews.Author: Kevin Deal
Reviews.Content: I buy a lot of cameras.  I bought the predesecors DMC-FX55 and it was fine, but would not zoom during video like my larger DMC-TZ1.  And the ZR3!!!I really need to read the manuals.  To my suprise, that there is a burst mode using flash, though at lower quality.  But it would have been helpful many many times.I just bough the larger expensive DMZ-TS10 and it didn't take as good a picture or video, is larger, and more expensive.  I just did a swing through South East Asia and misplaced my ZR3, so bought a replacement at $149 here on Amazon only to find the one I lost.  I kinda wished I would have kept it as I really really like this camera.  Now they raised the price $18 and they are discontinued.I know they will come up with something that trumphs it.  But regardless...I love this camera.  It's so small and cute you almost want to burp it.UPDATE August 11, 2011 I just left to France and wanted to have two cameras that take equal pictures. I somehow think that manufacturers will start making things cheaper after some point, having been in electronics for many years. I think the dmc-zr3 hits a sweet spot. Now they are all sold through the only ones you see are at a higher price. I bought an open stock one for $141 from adorama and it arrived in new condition. As I stated earlier it takes better pictures than the new dmc-zs10. I'm very happy with this model. If you stay within 10 ft of your subject the flash works just fine.

Reviews.Title: works very well
Reviews.Author: Jon Meline "Jon"
Reviews.Content: Haven't found any Cons to this one yet. Very good for the price, just got back from a snowmobile trip where it was below zero and it worked great outdoors!

Reviews.Title: Great photos and it fits in my pocket
Reviews.Author: J. A. Fields Jr.
Reviews.Content: Got a NIKON Coolpix for Christmas and the lens cover broke after 3 uses so I retuned it and got the Lumix to replace it.I get amazing photos even at long range. (this mini camera has an 8X optical zoom and 10X digital zoom.After dozens of uses, the automatic lens cover still works perfectly. A great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Yorky
